translated: The Summary of the Reversal Mode

original: Tattha katamo āvaṭṭo hārasampāto?🔽“Tasmā rakkhitacittassa, sammāsaṅkappagocaro”ti gāthā.
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāra sampāto  tasmā rakkhita cittassa sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ ti gāthā
translated: Herein, what is the summary of the reversal mode?🔽“Therefore, with guarded mind, One whose domain is right thinking” .

analyzed: tasmā rakkhita cittassa sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ ti samathaḥ
translated: “Therefore, with guarded mind, One whose domain is right thinking” is serenity.
“With right view as his forerunner” is insight.
“Having known rise and fall” is full-understanding of suffering.

analyzed: thinamiddha abhibhū bhikkhū ti samudaya pahāna
translated: “The monk who overcomes sloth and torpor” is the abandoning of the origin.
“Will leave all bad destinations” is cessation.
The reversal mode is applied to them.
